name: Number of Pairs of Interchangeable Rectangles

similar_questions.title: Count Nice Pairs in an Array

title: Number of Pairs of Interchangeable Rectangles
content:
You are given n rectangles represented by a 0-indexed 2D integer array rectangles, where rectangles[i] = [widthi, heighti] denotes the width and height of the ith rectangle.

Two rectangles i and j (i < j) are considered interchangeable if they have the same width-to-height ratio. More formally, two rectangles are interchangeable if widthi/heighti == widthj/heightj (using decimal division, not integer division).

Return the number of pairs of interchangeable rectangles in rectangles.

 

Example 1:

Input: rectangles = [[4,8],[3,6],[10,20],[15,30]]
Output: 6
Explanation: The following are the interchangeable pairs of rectangles by index (0-indexed):
- Rectangle 0 with rectangle 1: 4/8 == 3/6.
- Rectangle 0 with rectangle 2: 4/8 == 10/20.
- Rectangle 0 with rectangle 3: 4/8 == 15/30.
- Rectangle 1 with rectangle 2: 3/6 == 10/20.
- Rectangle 1 with rectangle 3: 3/6 == 15/30.
- Rectangle 2 with rectangle 3: 10/20 == 15/30.

Example 2:

Input: rectangles = [[4,5],[7,8]]
Output: 0
Explanation: There are no interchangeable pairs of rectangles.

 

Constraints:

  • n == rectangles.length
  • 1 <= n <= 105
  • rectangles[i].length == 2
  • 1 <= widthi, heighti <= 105

discussion_posts.name: shoumik916
discussion_posts.content: This should definitely be an Easy problem lol

discussion_posts.name: portalsigma2022
discussion_posts.content:
In the problem, we are taking a combination of k =2, in the formula N ! /(N-K) ! * K. Using this we can reduce the formula of combinations from N ! /(N-2) ! * 2.
That can be simplified to (N* (N-1)*(N-2) ! ) / (N-2) ! * 2,
gives (N * (N-1))/2.
N is the number of the total number of elements in the set.

discussion_posts.name: Captain_Yedla
discussion_posts.content:
I think, test cases are not that strong. 

problem comes with the floating point division support.

proper approach for this problem is not by division

1. bring every numerator / denomination to such level where there are no common factors

2. then combine numerator and denominator to a string

3. use hash table approach.

discussion_posts.name: tin_le
discussion_posts.content: this problem fits "Double it and give it to the next person" the most. Hint: it\'s just about counting the frequency

discussion_posts.name: StefanelStan
discussion_posts.content:
Tips:
- Use a Map<Double, Integer> to group/count the ratio of each rectangle
- Iterate over the values and if value > 1, use the combination formula n! / ((n-k)! * k!).
 When we know k = 2, short version of formula is ((n-1) * n / 2). Pay attention to long as 10^5 * 10^5 = 10^10.
https://leetcode.com/problems/number-of-pairs-of-interchangeable-rectangles/solutions/4572243/java-combinations-map-clean-code/

discussion_posts.name: arturszogla
discussion_posts.content: For me the difference between TLE and accepted Python solution came down to using `for key in dict:` (fast) instead of `for key in dict.keys():` (slow).

discussion_posts.name: ghostie404
discussion_posts.content: Think of the 2sum problem and how you\'re able to use past calculations to aid with current calculations.
